description.narrative:
China Synthetic Rubber Corporation (CSRC or the company) is a carbon black manufacturing company with the capacity to produce 60,000 tons per year (tpy) of carbon black and generate up to 9 MW of power from its co-generation facility, located in Maanshan City, Anhui Province, China. The company has requested IFC financing for the debottlenecking and expansion of the existing plant to increase its production capacity to 125,000 tpy.
The project will consist of two phases: - debottlenecking of the existing facility (phase I); - installing an additional production line and 12 MW of new power co-generation and building a new warehouse (phase II).
IFC financed the companys original project in 2001 (IFC/R2001-0140), which was to upgrade and modernize the obsolete carbon black plant acquired from a state-owned enterprise, providing $9.0 million in A loan and $2.0 million in equity for a 13.8% shareholding in the company.

name.narrative: The project is located in the industrial area of Cihu, a major industrial complex in the northwest section of Maanshan city in the Chinese province of Anhui, about 300 km west of Shanghai. At present, the area of the project site is approximately 137,158 m2 covering the carbon black production lines, power generation facility, feedstock storage, warehouse and administration buildings. As an expansion program, the project company may purchase the land use rights for an additional three adjacent lands to the current project site totaling 47,533 m2 some of which will cover two new production lines and the remainder reserved for future use.
